articles.headline: Why Monthly Auto Sales Numbers May Not Be What They Seem
articles.snippet: Consumer demand is leveling off after six straight years of rising sales, and car companies are under increasing pressure to show strong results, however they can.
articles.abstract: Consumer demand is leveling off after six straight years of rising sales, and car companies are under increasing pressure to show strong results, however they can.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — The steady growth in the American automobile market has been an economic success story: Carmakers set a record last year by selling more than 17.4 million new vehicles.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and Neal E. Boudette

articles.headline: Tim Kaine Recalled for Commitment to Richmond’s African-Americans
articles.snippet: He found himself navigating the charged history and sensitivities of the same African-American community he had embraced in his private life.
articles.abstract: He found himself navigating the charged history and sensitivities of the same African-American community he had embraced in his private life.
articles.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, Va. — He offered the first formal apology for this city’s role in the slave trade. He led the effort to add a statue of Arthur Ashe, a Richmond native, to its Monument Avenue. He attended a largely black church and sent his children to racially mixed schools.

articles.headline: Clinton? Trump? Either Way, Count on Deficit Spending to Rise
articles.snippet: Both candidates have some expensive proposals, and economists are coming around to the view that an increase in borrowing might be a good thing.
articles.abstract: Both candidates have some expensive proposals, and economists are coming around to the view that an increase in borrowing might be a good thing.
articles.lead_paragraph: For most voters, the idea of more government borrowing and spending is about as popular as the Zika virus. And while Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump agree on almost nothing, mainstream Democrats and Republicans alike often talk about the national debt the way prohibitionists once discussed booze.

articles.headline: How Paul Manafort Wielded Power in Ukraine Before Advising Donald Trump
articles.snippet: With Russia becoming a focus of the presidential campaign, Mr. Manafort’s work and business dealings in Ukraine have come under scrutiny.
articles.abstract: With Russia becoming a focus of the presidential campaign, Mr. Manafort’s work and business dealings in Ukraine have come under scrutiny.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Few political consultants have had a client fail quite as spectacularly as Paul Manafort’s did in Ukraine in the winter of 2014.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: Uber to Sell to Rival Didi Chuxing and Create New Business in China
articles.snippet: The merger ends more than a year of ruthless battles for market share in the mainland and values the new company at $35 billion.
articles.abstract: The merger ends more than a year of ruthless battles for market share in the mainland and values the new company at $35 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Uber’s future in China seemed to hold promise.
articles.byline: By Paul Mozur and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: John McCain Denounces Donald Trump’s Comments on Family of Muslim Soldier
articles.snippet: In a strongly worded statement, Mr. McCain said Mr. Trump’s remarks disparaging a fallen soldier’s family do not “represent the views of our Republican Party.”
articles.abstract: In a strongly worded statement, Mr. McCain said Mr. Trump’s remarks disparaging a fallen soldier’s family do not “represent the views of our Republican Party.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator John McCain sharply criticized Donald J. Trump’s comments about the family of a fallen Muslim Army captain on Monday, a rebuke that provided an opening for other vulnerable Republican senators to do the same, even though they all stopped short of rescinding their endorsements of him.
